Thursday, 12 September 2019 11.47.01:
CRUD User GUI implementation started.

Thursday, 12 September 2019 11.47.01:
CRUD User GUI implementation started. -------------------------------------------------- Thursday, 12 September 2019 17.31.34:
Started to implement cache "supervisor", an object/system that coordinates the caches and checks which one is ready which one is not.
The rendering can only stop once all caches are ready.

Thursday, 12 September 2019 11.47.01:
CRUD User GUI implementation started. -------------------------------------------------- Thursday, 12 September 2019 17.31.34:
Started to implement cache "supervisor", an object/system that coordinates the caches and checks which one is ready which one is not.
The rendering can only stop once all caches are ready.

Simplified the "cache injector" "logic". -------------------------------------------------- Monday, 16 September 2019 0.23.53:
The "new" re-render trigger-er did not work. Switched back to the old one. Need to look into this later a bit more.
For now, I put this "project"/"refactoring" on hold and proceed with implementing logic for User CRUD functionality.

Monday, 23 September 2019 3.08.52:
Introduced the "PostRequestType", phantom type.
Now I have lot of type errors, all over the place.
They either need to be fixed, or we roll back and remove this phantom type parameter.

Monday, 23 September 2019 3.08.52:
Introduced the "PostRequestType", phantom type.
Now I have lot of type errors, all over the place.
They either need to be fixed, or we roll back and remove this phantom type parameter. -------------------------------------------------- Monday, 23 September 2019 18.20.06:
Phantom type is still in the code.
I used a _ for the type parameter at a lot of places. Also I have a few ???-s and a few todo-now-s, so, even though the code compiles now, it will fail at runtime, most likely.
So the ???-s and todo-now-s have to be fixed, and after that we need to see how to separate the "write" and "read" cache / logic in the app, for which the phantom type parameter was introduced.
Possibly different type classes for the caches, or some sort of "master cache", or "cache supervisor", an an extra layer of abstraction above the current client caching ... we need to see... it's not clear yet.
A bit of experimentation is ahead on the road.

Starting to implement a very explicit UserEditorComp, which will contain the update logic explicitly and we will be able to follow and control - in the browser - on the page - how the update, cache invalidation and reloading will take place, step by step.
Later this logic will be generalized and moved "somewhere elsewhere", where exactly, I don't know yet. Possibly into some helper function, residing somewhere in the Cache's companion object - or some conceptually closely related place.

I used a _ for the type parameter at a lot of places. Also I have a few ???-s and a few todo-now-s, so, even though the code compiles now, it will fail at runtime, most likely.
So the ???-s and todo-now-s have to be fixed, and after that we need to see how to separate the "write" and "read" cache / logic in the app, for which the phantom type parameter was introduced.
Possibly different type classes for the caches, or some sort of "master cache", or "cache supervisor", an an extra layer of abstraction above the current client caching ... we need to see... it's not clear yet.
A bit of experimentation is ahead on the road.

Later this logic will be generalized and moved "somewhere elsewhere", where exactly, I don't know yet. Possibly into some helper function, residing somewhere in the Cache's companion object - or some conceptually closely related place.
